name: Chef John
bio: Chef John is a Chinese cuisine expert with over 20 years of experience. He loves to experiment with flavors and textures, and his recipes are always a hit with his fans.

recipes.name: Kung Pao Chicken
recipes.cooking_method: Cut the chicken into small cubes and marinate it with soy sauce and cornstarch. Stir-fry the chicken in a hot wok until browned, then add the Szechuan peppercorns, red bell pepper, and scallions. Serve hot with rice.

recipes.name: Hot and Sour Soup
recipes.cooking_method: Boil the chicken broth in a pot and add the mushrooms, bamboo shoots, vinegar, and white pepper. Add some beaten eggs and stir until cooked. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Moo Shu Pork
recipes.cooking_method: Thinly slice the pork and stir-fry it with the cabbage, carrots, and wood ear mushrooms. Add hoisin sauce and cook until the vegetables are tender. Serve with pancakes and scallions.

name: Chef Wang
bio: Chef Wang is a master of Chinese street food. He has been cooking since he was a child and his recipes are inspired by the flavors of his hometown.

recipes.name: Dumplings
recipes.cooking_method: Mix the ground pork with green onions, ginger, soy sauce, and sesame oil. Spoon the filling into dumpling wrappers and seal them by pinching the edges together. Boil the dumplings until cooked and serve with soy sauce and vinegar.

recipes.name: Scallion Pancakes
recipes.cooking_method: Mix flour, salt, and water to make the dough. Roll the dough into a thin pancake and sprinkle scallions on top. Roll the pancake into a cylinder

recipes.name: Dumplings
recipes.cooking_method: Mix the ground pork with green onions, ginger, soy sauce, and sesame oil. Spoon the filling into dumpling wrappers and seal them by pinching the edges together. Boil the dumplings until cooked and serve with soy sauce and vinegar.

name: Liu Chang
bio: Liu Chang is a master chef from Beijing with over 20 years of experience. She specializes in Sichuan and Cantonese cuisines and has won numerous awards for her innovative dishes.

recipes.name: Kung Pao Chicken
recipes.cooking_method: 1. Cut chicken into small cubes and marinate with cornstarch and soy sauce. 2. Heat vegetable oil and sesame oil in a wok over high heat. 3. Add chicken and stir-fry until browned. 4. Add garlic, peanuts, bell peppers, and onion. Stir-fry for 1-2 minutes. 5. Serve hot with rice.

recipes.name: Hot and Sour Soup
recipes.cooking_method: 1. Bring chicken broth to a boil in a large pot. 2. Add mushrooms, bamboo shoots, tofu, soy sauce, rice vinegar, and chili paste. 3. Simmer for 5-10 minutes. 4. Beat the egg in a small bowl and pour it slowly into the soup while stirring. 5. Garnish with chopped scallions. 6. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Ma Po Tofu
recipes.cooking_method: 1. Cut tofu into small cubes. 2. Heat vegetable oil in a wok over medium heat. 3. Add garlic, ginger, and ground pork. Stir-fry until pork is browned. 4. Add doubanjiang, soy sauce, and Sichuan peppercorn powder. Stir-fry for 1-2 minutes. 5. Add tofu and stir gently. 6. Simmer for 5-10 minutes. 7. Garnish with chopped scallions. 8. Serve hot with rice.

name: Xiao Ming
bio: Xiao Ming is a Chinese chef with over 15 years of experience. He is known for his spicy Sichuan dishes and has won several awards for his cooking.

recipes.name: Kung Pao Chicken
recipes.method:
1. Cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces. 
2. Mix together the cornstarch and soy sauce in a bowl, then add the chicken and toss to coat. 
3. Heat the oil in a wok or large frying pan over high heat. Add the chicken and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes or until lightly browned. 
4. Add the peanuts and continue to stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes. 
5. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Hot and Sour Soup
recipes.method:
1. In a large pot, bring the chicken stock to a boil. 
2. Add the tofu, bamboo shoots, and mushrooms and bring back to a boil. 
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the cornstarch and water to make a slurry. 
4. Slowly pour the slurry into the soup while stirring constantly. 
5. Add the rice vinegar and stir to combine. 
6. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Mapo Tofu
recipes.method:
1. Cut the tofu into small cubes. 
2. Brown the ground pork in a wok or large frying pan. 
3. Add the garlic and scallions and cook for 1-2 minutes. 
4. Add the chili bean paste and cook for another minute. 
5. Add the tofu and a cup of water. 
6. Simmer for 5-10 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened. 
7. Serve hot.
